chapter.title: Tools
chapter.para: Several software tools are used to manage the FreeBSD documentation and render it to different output formats. Some of these tools are required and must be installed before working through the examples in the following chapters. Some are optional, adding capabilities or making the job of creating documentation less demanding.

sect1.title: Required Tools
sect1.para: Install textproc/docproj from the Ports Collection. This meta-port installs all the applications required to do useful work with the &os; documentation. Some further notes on particular components are given below.

sect2.title: DTDs and Entities
sect2.para: &os; documentation uses several Document Type Definitions (DTDs) and sets of XML entities. These are all installed by the textproc/docproj port.

listitem.para: XHTML is the markup language of choice for the World Wide Web, and is used throughout the &os; web site.
DocBook is designed for marking up technical documentation. Most of the &os; documentation is written in DocBook.

Character entities from the ISO 8879:1986 standard used by many DTDs. Includes named mathematical symbols, additional characters in the Latin character set (accents, diacriticals, and so on), and Greek symbols.

sect1.title: Optional Tools
sect1.para: These applications are not required, but can make working on the documentation easier or add capabilities.

listitem.para: A popular editor for working with XML and derived documents, like DocBook XML.

Both of these editors include a special mode for editing documents marked up according to an XML DTD. This mode includes commands to reduce the amount of typing needed, and help reduce the possibility of errors.
